paragraph.sentence: In June 2019, 914 sq km of the Legal Amazon were deforested, according to data from the National Institute for Space Research (INPE).
The main cause of deforestation was clear-cut deforestation, which leaves the soil clear of any vegetation, responsible for 835 sq km of deforested area.
The state with the most deforestation in the month was Pará (454 sq km), and the most devastated municipality was Altamira/Pará, where deforestation amounted to 95 sq km.
The most devastated Nature Protected Area in the month was the JAMANXIM NATIONAL FOREST in Pará, where deforestation amounted to 12 sq km.
INSTITUTE_1 estimated that the deforestation of LOCATION_1 amounted to AREA_1 in MONTH_1 YEAR_1 , which represents an increase of VARIATION_1 compared to the previous month .
Amounting to AREA_1 , the main cause of land degradation was CAUSE_1 , which removes all vegetation of the soil .
The most deforested municipality in the month was CITY_1 ( AREA_1 ) , in the state of STATE_1 , and the most affected state overall was STATE_2 ( AREA_2 ) .
The Nature Protected Area where there was the most deforestation was UC_1 , in STATE_1 , where AREA_1 of land were cut down .

paragraph.sentence: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) estimated that the deforestation of the Legal Amazon amounted to 2255 sq km in July 2019, which represents an increase of 147% compared to the previous month.
Amounting to 2005 sq km, the main cause of land degradation was clear-cut deforestation, which removes all vegetation of the soil.
The most deforested municipality in the month was Altamira(178 sq km), in the state of Pará, and the most affected state overall was Pará (891 sq km).
The Nature Protected Area where there was the most deforestation was the TAPAJÓS ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AREA, in the state of Pará, where 15 sq km of land were cut down.

paragraph.sentence: Deforestation amounted to 1707 sq km in the Legal Amazon in August 2019, according to data from the National Institute for Space Research (INPE).
The main cause of destruction of the Amazon in the month (1671 sq km) was the deforestation that clears all vegetation of the soil, called clear-cut deforestation.
The state that had the most deforestation in the month was Pará, amounting to 820 sq km of devasted area.
São Felix do Xingu, in the state of Pará, was the most affected municipality, where 154 sq km were deforested.
The JAMANXIN NATIONAL FOREST in the state of Pará was the most devastated Nature Protected Area in August, where deforestation amounted to 22 sq km.

paragraph.sentence: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) estimated that deforestation of the Legal Amazon amounted to 1451 sq km in September 2019.
Most of the deforested area (1434 sq km) was a result of clear-cutting, which removes all vegetation coverage from the soil.

The state of Pará was the most affected in September, where deforestation amounted to 500 sq km, and Porto Velho, state of Rondônia, was the municipality with the most deforestation (102 sq km) in the same period.
The most affected Nature Protected Area in the month was the CHICO MENDES EXTRACTIVIST RESERVE / Acre, where 16 sq km of forest were lost.

paragraph.sentence: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) detected 555 sq km of forest clearing in the Legal Amazon in October 2019.
The most affected state and municipality were respectively the state of Pará (286 sq km) and Portel, in the state of Pará (48 sq km).
The most affected Nature Protected Area in October was the JAMANXIM NATIONAL FOREST (in the state of Pará), where devastation amounted to 3 sq km.

paragraph.sentence: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) estimated that deforestation amounted to 563 sq km in the Legal Amazon in November 2019, an increase of 2% in deforestation rate compared to the previous month.
Responsible for 549 sq km of deforested area, the main cause of destruction was clear-cutting, which removes all vegetation coverage from the soil.
The most deforested municipality was São Félix do Xingu (31 sq km), state of Pará, and the most affected state was Pará (343 sq km).

paragraph.sentence: According to the National Institute for Space Research (INPE), 190 sq km were chopped out of the Legal Amazon in December 2019.

paragraph.sentence: INPE says that 284 sq km of forest were cleared across the Legal Amazon in January, 2020, which is a 50% increase from the previous month.
The main class of deforestation was clear-cut deforestation, which leaves the soil clear of vegetation, responsible for 264 sq km of deforested area.
The most deforested state was Mato Grosso, where 124 square kilometers of forest were chopped of.
The most affected city was Paranatinga, in the state of Mato Grosso, where 26 square kilometers of land were deforested.
The Nature Protected Area where there was the most deforestation was the TAPAJÓS ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AREA, in the state of Pará, where 2 square kilometers of land were deforested.

paragraph.sentence: An area of approximately 186 sq km was deforested in the legal Amazon, in February 2020, according to the National Institute for Space Research (INPE).
The main class of deforestation was clear-cut deforestation, which leaves the land clear of vegetation, responsible for 180 sq km of deforested area.
Mato Grosso was the most affected state, where 75 sq km were deforested.
Marcelandia (in the state of Mato Grosso), where 37 sq km of forest were chopped out, ranked the worst in terms of deforestation.

paragraph.sentence: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) reported that 326 sq km of land were deforested in the Legal Amazon in March 2020.
Compared to the previous month, deforestation increased by 76%.
The main class of deforestation was clear-cutting, which clears the soil of vegetation, responsible for 317 sq km of deforested area.
Pará was the state where there was the most impact of deforestation (122 sq km).
Altamira was the most affected municipality (77 sq km).
In March, the Nature Protected Area that held the record for deforestation was the JAMANXIM NATIONAL FOREST, in the state of Pará (3 sq km).

paragraph.sentence: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) reported that 407 sq km of forest were cleared across the Legal Amazon in April 2020, which represents a 25% increase from the previous month.
Those numbers represent a 171% increase in deforestation rate in April of the current year from the same month of the previous year.
The main class of deforestation was clear-cut deforestation, which completely clears the soil of vegetation, responsible for 393 sq km of deforested area.
The most deforested state was Mato Grosso, where 145 square kilometers of forest were chopped of.
The municipality that concentrated the most deforestation was Porto Velho, state of Rondônia, where 39 sq km of land were deforested.
In April, the most affected Nature Protected Area, where 6 sq km were cleared of vegetation, was the JAMANXIM NATIONAL FOREST, in the state of Pará.

paragraph.sentence: According to the National Institute for Space Research (INPE), 885 sq km of forestland were deforested in the Legal Amazon in May 2020.
Compared to the previous month, there was a 118% increase in deforestation rate.
The main class of deforestation was clear-cut deforestation, that leaves the soil clear of vegetation, responsible for 841 sq km of deforested area.
Pará was the state where there was the most impact of deforestation (418 sq km).
The most affected municipality was Altamira, in the state of Pará (161 sq km).
The Nature Protected Area where the most deforestation occurred was the JAMANXIM NATIONAL FOREST, in the state of PA (16 sq km).
